original: Jönsson, John Gösta Alfons, komminister, Skreanäs, f. 6/11/06 i Lund-by, Gbgs o. Boh. 1., av slöjdlär. Carl G. J. o. Elin Pietersson. G. 36 m. Ain’a Wesismian. Barn : Stina f. 37, Lema 39, Anders 41, Agneta 45, Kerstin 47. — Studiex. i Gbg 26, teol. fil. ex. 27, teol. kand., prakt. teol. prov samt prästv. f. Gbgs stift 32. Pastorsadj. i ValMa 32, v. kommin. i Mölndal 34, i 33 Stafsinge 37, v. pastor i Vinberg 38, kyrkoadj. i Svenljun-ga s. å., kommin. i Skrea sed. 45, ordf. o. ’led. i flera kommunala styr. o. nd :r.
translated: Jönsson, John Gösta Alfons, minister, Skreanäs, born November 6, 1906 in Lund-by, Gothenburg and Bohuslän, first child of Carl G. J. and Elin Pietersson who was a technical arts teacher. Married Ain’a Wesismian in 1936 and they had five children: Stina (born 1937), Lema (born 1939), Anders (born 1941), Agneta (born 1945), and Kerstin (born 1947). He obtained a bachelor's degree in Gothenburg in 1926, and then obtained a theology degree in 1927, passed a practical theological exam, and became a priest in the Gothenburg diocese in 1932. He was a pastor assistant in ValMa in 1932, deputy minister in Mölndal in 1934, and in 1937 he became a deputy pastor in Stafsinge and then a pastor in Vinberg in 1938. He was a church assistant in Svenljunga in the same year and then became a minister in Skrea in 1945. He was also a chairman and member of several municipal committees.
